attributes.action: Honour Margaret Thatcher as Britain's First Female Prime Minister
attributes.additional_details: Parliament should mark the achievements of Margaret Thatcher with a statue outside Parliament.
attributes.background:
Margaret Thatcher was Britain's first female Prime Minister.
She broke the glass ceiling for all women by becoming the first female leader of her party and ultimately Prime Minister. Previous leaders of the party had all been male.
We believe her achievements should be honoured.

rejection.details:
There is already a statue of Baroness Thatcher in Parliament. You can find out about the statue here:

http://www.parliament.uk/business/committees/committees-archive/acwa/thatcherstatue/
